Definition at line 3670 of file model.php.

$Modules

Master module configuration struct.

This array provides all the configuration parameters needed for each module. Detailed behaviour of each module is defined thru the settings in this array.

Parameters:
Name Translatable name of the module.
Fields Array of columns to show on Logs pages. Parsers may produce more fields than those listed here, e.g. for statistics functions.
SubMenus Each module page may have its own submenus (pages). Sub-fields should be php file names. These sub-fields also point to another array. The indeces of this array are used for $_GET method url, and are associated with the translatable title of sub-page.
HighlightLogs Used for coloring log lines, holds params for coloring function
HighlightLogs>Col Column/field to search for keywords (to color the line)
HighlightLogs>Tag Tag to use in the HTML style, usually 'class', but also 'id'
HighlightLogs>Keywords Contains keywords for red, yellow, and green. Precedence being in that order.
Stats Parent field in configuration details used on statistics pages.
Stats>Total Mandatory sub-field for each Stats field. Configures the the general settings for the basic stats for the module.
Stats>Total>Title Title to display on top of the graph.
Stats>Total>Cmd Command line to get log lines. Usually to get all lines.
Stats>Total>Needle To get only those lines that contain the Needle text among the lines obtained by Stats>Total>Cmd.
Stats>Total>Color The color of the bars on the graph.
Stats>Total>NVPs Name-Value-Pairs to print at the bottom of the graph. Usually top 5 of some of the more important stats. Displayed in 2 columns.
Stats>Total>BriefStats Statistics (parsed field names) to collect as BriefStats. Top 100 of collected data are shown on the left of General statistics page.
Stats>Total>Counters Statistics to collect and show as a graph over total data. The difference between these counters and Stats><StatName> is that these are collected using the command line for the Total stats. So there is no separate Cmd field. Counters has one extra field, Divisor, which is used to divide the total count. Usually need to convert bytes to kilobytes.
Stats><StatName> Custom statistics to be collected. The data for these graphs are collected using the Cmd and Needle fields. Stats>Total>Counters could have been merged with this one perhaps. The sub-fields for these custom stats is the same as the Total field described above.
Todo:
